Description: Panasonic Corporation and a Whirlpool Corporation subsidiary, Embraco North America Inc., agreed to plead guilty and to pay a total of $140.9 million in criminal fines for their role in an international conspiracy to fix the prices of refrigerant compressors used in refrigerators and freezers in homes and businesses.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/panasonic-corp-and-whirlpool-corp-subsidiary-agree-plead-guilty-role-price-fixing-conspiracy

Description: After OFCCP determined  that a hiring process used to screen job applicants at the factory from March  1997 to February 1998 created an adverse impact on certain applicants Whirlpool agreed to an $850,000 settlement.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20180423114510/http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/whirlpool-cited-for-inadvertent-adverse-impact-in-1997-1998-hiring-practice-at-oklahoma-factory-67299147.html
Notes: Source document was unavailable from OFCCP so a Whirlpool press release is listed as the information source.
